intro: Laetia ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf laetia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
